title: Schedule
content:
Schedule# Note: The schedule below is tentative and subject to change.
Important Links (Assignment Related)# Paper Presentations
- Google Slides Template: LINK. - Due by 5pm the day before your presentation (piazza post with slides and discussion topics). 'Implement Something' Assignment/Presentation
- Details coming soon. Final Project
- Details coming soon. ðŸ§­ Module 1: Fundamentals# Class 1 â€” Tue, Jan 20, 2026
Topic: Introduction
Goal: (to be filled)
Slides: LINK Class 2 â€” Thu, Jan 22, 2026
Topic: The Paper 'Draft' & Fundamentals Primer
Goal: Sign up for paper presentations and a quick review of common terms and formulations used in the robotics literature.
Slides: LINK Additional Resources:
Springer Handbook of Robotics Class 3 â€” Tue, Jan 27, 2026
Topic: Fundamentals 1: The Needs and Opportunities of Robots
Goal: We will start with a broad perspective about opportunities for robots and research progress over a longer horizon.
Collaborative Robots and Industrial Revolution 4.0 (IR 4.0) The Evolution of Robotics Research â€” From Industrial Robotics to Field and Service Robotics Class 4 â€” Thu, Jan 29, 2026
Topic: Fundamentals 2: Moving Your Robot & System Complexity
Goal: Robot research often involves deploying full-stack systems. Here we will look at an example modular system as well as a technique (developed at UW-Madison) for inverse kinematics which is a critical stack component for most approaches today.
DexPilot: Vision-Based Teleoperation of Dexterous Robotic Handâ€“Arm Systems RelaxedIK: Real-time Synthesis of Accurate and Feasible Robot Arm Motion Class 5 â€” Tue, Feb 3, 2026
Topic: Fundamentals 3: Planning Motions
Goal: Review of common planning techiques and a more recent approach for planning around complex obstacles.
Motion Planning: The Essentials Motion Planning Around Obstacles with Convex Optimization Additional Resources:
Collision-Affording Point Trees: SIMD-Amenable Nearest Neighbors for Fast Collision Checking *(recent high-performance path planning RSS paper)* ðŸ¤– Module 2: Learning# Class 6 â€” Thu, Feb 5, 2026
Topic: Learning Primer
Goal: Review high-level architectures/approaches to robot learning, including imitation learning, RL, and IRL.
Slides: LINK Additional Resources:
ALVINN: AN AUTONOMOUS LAND VEHICLE IN A NEURAL NETWORK (original BC paper). Class 7 â€” Tue, Feb 10, 2026
Topic: Learning 1: Foundations
Goal: Review classical learning techniques, including movement primitives and behavior cloning.
Movement Primitives Behavioral Cloning from Observation Additional Resources:
Generative Adversarial Imitation Learning (another historical but more recent approach to imitation learning) Class 8 â€” Thu, Feb 12, 2026
Topic: Learning 2: End-to-End & Meta-Learning
Goal: The first paper was a bit moment in robotics that demonstrated learning could be achieved without intermediate representations (pixels to motor torques). The second paper was an influential early work about adopting existing models to new tasks (toward better robot learning generalization).
End-to-End Learning Model-Agnostic Meta-Learning for Fast Adaptation of Deep Networks Class 9 â€” Tue, Feb 17, 2026
Topic: Learning 3: Intermediate Representations in Learning
Goal: We will look at two learning approaches that anchor on an intermediate representation: IRL where the model infers a reward function and 'yell at your robot' which has a high-level and low-level policy.
Maximum Entropy Inverse Reinforcement Learning Yell At Your Robot: Improving On-the-Fly from Language Corrections Class 10 â€” Thu, Feb 19, 2026
Topic: Literature Review Workshop
Goal: We will discuss stratgies for finding relevant research literature and do an in-class exercise where we search for papers related to a topic.
Slides: LINK Class 11 â€” Tue, Feb 24, 2026
Topic: Learning 4: The Rise of Generative Learning
Goal: Two papers representing an inflection point in robot learning where LLMs and generative models began to really take off in robotics.
Do As I Can, Not As I Say: Grounding Language in Robotic Affordances Diffusion Policy: Visuomotor Policy Learning via Action Diffusion Class 12 â€” Thu, Feb 26, 2026
Topic: Learning 5: Practical Considerations in Learning
Goal: Recent learning methods have less parameter sensitivity, but there are still many small considerations that can make or break learning systems.
What Matters in Learning from Offline Data On the Continuity of Rotation Representations in Neural Networks Additional Resources:
Much Ado About Noising: Dispelling the Myths of Generative Robotic Control (recent paper challenging the need of high capacity generative models in learning) Class 13 â€” Tue, Mar 3, 2026
Topic: Learning 6: Frontiers
Goal: (to be filled)
Ï€âˆ—0.6: a VLA That Learns From Experience mimic-video: Video-Action Models for Generalizable Robot Control Beyond VLAs Additional Resources:
